00036 Vector3D::Vector3D() {
00037         this->x = 0.0;
00038         this->y = 0.0;
00039         this->z = 0.0;
00040 }

00042 Vector3D::Vector3D(Vector3D *point) {
00043         this->x = point->getX();
00044         this->y = point->getY();
00045         this->z = point->getZ();
00046 }

00048 Vector3D::Vector3D(Coordinate x, Coordinate y, Coordinate z) {
00049         this->x = x;
00050         this->y = y;
00051         this->z = z;

00080 void Vector3D::getRawData(Coordinate *pointBuffer) {
00081         pointBuffer[0] = x;
00082         pointBuffer[1] = y;
00083         pointBuffer[2] = z;
00084 }
00085 
00086 Vector3D Vector3D::operator +(const Vector3D *point) {
00087         Vector3D result;
00088         result.x = this->x + point->x;
00089         result.y = this->y + point->y;
00090         result.z = this->z + point->z;
00091 
00092         /* check if any value of x,y,z is infinity or not a number */
00093         if ((!(isfinite(result.x)) && (result.x != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.y))
00094                         && (result.y != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.z))
00095                         && (result.z != 0.0))) {
00096                 throw runtime_error(
00097                                 "Point3D operation exceeds the limit of Coordinate datatype representation.");
00098         }
00099 
00100         return result;
00101 }
00102 
00103 Vector3D Vector3D::operator -(const Vector3D *point) {
00104         Vector3D result;
00105         result.x = this->x - point->x;
00106         result.y = this->y - point->y;
00107         result.z = this->z - point->z;
00108 
00109         /* check if any value of x,y,z is infinity or not a number */
00110         if ((!(isfinite(result.x)) && (result.x != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.y))
00111                         && (result.y != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.z))
00112                         && (result.z != 0.0))) {
00113                 throw runtime_error(
00114                                 "Point3D operation exceeds the limit of Coordinate datatype representation.");
00115         }
00116 
00117         return result;
00118 }
00119 
00120 Vector3D Vector3D::operator *(double scalar) {
00121         Vector3D result;
00122         result.x = (this->x) * static_cast<Coordinate>(scalar);
00123         result.y = (this->y) * static_cast<Coordinate>(scalar);
00124         result.z = (this->z) * static_cast<Coordinate>(scalar);
00125 
00126         /* check if any value of x,y,z is infinity or not a number */
00127         if ((!(isfinite(result.x)) && (result.x != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.y))
00128                         && (result.y != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.z))
00129                         && (result.z != 0.0))) {
00130                 throw runtime_error(
00131                                 "Point3D operation exceeds the limit of Coordinate datatype representation.");
00132         }
00133 
00134         return result;
00135 }
00136 
00137 Vector3D& Vector3D::operator=(const Vector3D &point) {
00138         if (this == &point) { //case of self assignment
00139                 return *this;
00140         }
00141         this->x = point.getX();
00142         this->y = point.getY();
00143         this->z = point.getZ();
00144         return *this;
00145 }
00146 
00147 void Vector3D::homogeneousTransformation(IHomogeneousMatrix44 *transformation) { //TODO throw exception if values exceed limits
00148         // NOTE: currently everything is done in "double" and afterward transformed to "Coordinate"
00149         // This might involve implicit conversions between types (float to double e.g.) for each transformation...
00150         const double *homogenousMatrix;
00151         double xTemp;
00152         double yTemp;
00153         double zTemp;
00154 
00155         homogenousMatrix = transformation->getRawData();
00156 
00157         /*
00158          * layout:
00159          * 0 4 8  12
00160          * 1 5 9  13
00161          * 2 6 10 14
00162          * 3 7 11 15
00163          */
00164 
00165         /* rotate */;
00166         xTemp = x * homogenousMatrix[0] + y * homogenousMatrix[4] + z * homogenousMatrix[8];
00167         yTemp = x * homogenousMatrix[1] + y * homogenousMatrix[5] + z * homogenousMatrix[9];
00168         zTemp = x * homogenousMatrix[2] + y * homogenousMatrix[6] + z * homogenousMatrix[10];
00169 
00170         /* translate */
00171         x = static_cast<Coordinate>(xTemp + homogenousMatrix[12]);
00172         y = static_cast<Coordinate>(yTemp + homogenousMatrix[13]);
00173         z = static_cast<Coordinate>(zTemp + homogenousMatrix[14]);
00174 }
00175 
00176 istream& operator>>(istream &inStream, Vector3D &point) {
00177         if (!inStream.good())
00178                 throw runtime_error("ERROR: cannot read x coordinate of point.");
00179         inStream >> point.x;
00180         if (!inStream.good())
00181                 throw runtime_error("ERROR: cannot read y coordinate of point.");
00182         inStream >> point.y;
00183         if (!inStream.good())
00184                 throw runtime_error("ERROR: cannot read z coordinate of point.");
00185         inStream >> point.z;
00186 
00187         return inStream;
00188 }
00189 
00190 ostream& operator<<(ostream &outStream, const Vector3D &point) {
00191         outStream << point.getX() << " " << point.getY() << " " << point.getZ();
00192 
00193         return outStream;
00194 }
